Ask HN: For my 6y.o. – the key ideas of trading card/deck games
text:
My six year old son has been creating trading cards, hand drawn cards of magical beasts with powers, attacks and defenses. They've become a hit at school. He's set up a small stall and he's taking orders on a little index card from students and teachers. At the end of the day he comes home with the list "Morgan wants infinite deathmage..." and starts drawing.

But neither he, his friends nor I have every got into trading card games, any of the gamut from pokemon to magic the gathering. So the cards are great but the game is dull, basically just rock/paper/scissors.

I know some will say the meta game of r/p/s is infinitely deep, but what I really would like your help with is an intro to how trading card/deck games work. I can go online and read the rules of game X, but I'm turning to you, who have the perspective of deep investment of many years in multiple games, to ask what captivated you, and with that perspective what general architecture patterns have you come to see? what makes them fun for you, and what basic ideas he can think about introducing that make choices and strategy interesting without making the rules too complex for kids to understand?

Thanks

m.c.t

Ask HN: Why doesn't Copilot for Business use your organization's actual repos?
text:
I was just looking at the page for Copilot for Business ( https://docs.github.com/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/copilot/overview-of-github-copilot/about-github-copilot-for-business ), and while it does offer some useful things for business users versus the regular Copilot product, it seems to me that they could make it much more powerful by fine-tuning a smaller model on all the repos in an organization (even private ones) that could generate additional recommendations that take into account all the existing code a company has. Obviously, users would want assurances that these personalized models wouldn't be shared with anyone outside of the organization, but Microsoft has enough credibility that I think many businesses would try it in hopes of enhanced productivity.

Is it because it would be cost prohibitive? Maybe it only makes sense to fine tune a model if there are at least N users in the organization. Anyway, curious if anyone here has insights into this. Also interested in whether there are other companies offering this kind of product.

Show HN: Serializd: An App for TV Logging
text:
Hello HN! I wanted to share a passion project of mine. Its called Serializd, and its an app that allows you to track your TV content. Think of it like a Goodreads for TV (or a Letterboxd for TV).

Its currently available on iOS, Android, and the Web.

I built the iOS and Android apps using React Native. The web version uses NextJS on the Frontend, and Django on the Backend.

Currently, Serializd has 100k+ users. There is a strong focus on community and interacting with other people as you're logging your own TV watching and keeping up with the newest TV shows.

Stripe payments has ruined my life
text:
I don’t know what to do with myself anymore.

I am writing this message to plead for your help as my family and I are currently facing financial hardship due to Stripe's unfair treatment towards our business.

For over 4 years, we have provided excellent customer service and top of the line services via Stripe, with a low dispute rate compared to the amount of payments and customers we have had. However, after a surge in sales during the Christmas and New Year period, Stripe asked for verification on my account, which was previously verified in 2019. I provided all the necessary documents as requested, but Stripe then placed a 25% reserve on all sales for 120 days.

To my disbelief, the very next day my Stripe account was locked with a message stating that they could not support my business, and I was unable to contact support through my account. Since then, our business has been severely impacted, and Stripe is withholding over $15,000, which is affecting our ability to pay our bills and buy food.

Despite multiple attempts to seek assistance from Stripe, their auto-reply emails from employees in India have provided no justice, and their replies are short and dry with no explanation. As a result, I am now seeking help from anyone who can offer assistance as we are in dire need of the locked funds to support our family and business.

If you have any information or can provide assistance, please do not hesitate to contact me. I am deeply grateful for any help you can offer in this situation.

Thank you :(
